h1.span: How to create a new account in Steam ?

div.p: Here im going to show you how to create a new account by using the Steam client.
div.div:
Prerequisites : You need to download the Steam client first before you can create a new account.Here is the link from where you can dowload it. https://store.steampowered.com/
Open you'r steam client that looks like this :
Click the "Create a New Account..." button from the Steam login page.
After you click "Create a New Account" then it will show you a window with information that needs to be filled in order to create a new account.
Result: After you finish writing down the information that is needed, the end result should look like this.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

h1.span: How can you use all the functionalities of Steam(requirements) ?

div.p: Here im going to show you how to unlock all the functionalities that Steam can offer.
Prerequisites : You need to download the Steam client first before you can use it's functionalities. Here is the link from where you can dowload it. https://store.steampowered.com/
You will need to spend at least $5.00 USD within the Steam store.
Some examples of purchases that grant access to these features are:

ul.li: Adding the equivalent of $5 USD or more to your Steam Wallet.
Purchasing game(s) that are equal to $5 USD or more from the Steam store.

Adding a Steam Wallet card that is equal to $5 USD or more to your Steam account
Each Steam purchase total will be tracked in USD. If your Steam store's currency isn't in USD, it will be tracked and converted to USD automatically using daily exchange rates.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

h1.span: How to sent a friend request ?

div.p: Here im going to show you how to sent a friend request.
Prerequisites : You need to download the Steam client first before you can sent a friend request. Here is the link from where you can dowload it.https://store.steampowered.com/

ol.li: After you open the Steam client, you will see at the bottom of your right screen the button FRIENDS & CHAT. Click it.
Then it will open a new window.After that you can click the button "Add a friend".
After you click "Add a friend " button, it will appear a new tab with your code and a space to write you'r friends code to add them.
After you write down you'r friend's code then press the button "Enter" from your keyboard.

div.p: Result:They'll get a notification that you've sent a friend request. When they accept the invite, you'll be added to each other's Friends List.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

h1.span: How to search your type of game ?

div.p: Here im going to show you how to search you'r type of game.
Prerequisites : You need to download the Steam client first before you can search for you'r type of game. Here is the link from where you can dowload it.https://store.steampowered.com/

ol.li: Then you click the button "Categories". Its location is next to "New & Noteworthy" and "Points Shop"

After you write down you'r friend's code then press the button "Enter" from your keyboard.
Result:

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: Here im going to show you how to purchase you'r favorite games.
Prerequisites : You need to download the Steam client first before you can purchase you'r favorite game. Here is the link from where you can dowload it.https://store.steampowered.com/

ol.li: Start you'r Steam application from you'r executable file.
Then go to the "search tab" and add the title of the game that you want to search.
After you add you'r game title It will show you the result of your search.
Then you can browse and click the "product" that you wish to inspect.It will show you a detail screen of the game.
After you decide that you want to purchase this "product" you can click the "Add to Cart" button.
Then it will ask you if you'r purchasing it for "youtself" or for a "friend"
After you choose one of thoese options and then it will show you the "payment information".

And finally after you fill the information needed, click the "Continue" button to complete the purchase.
Result : After you completed all the steps, the purchase should be complete.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: Steam is a video game digital distribution service by Valve. It was launched as a standalone software client in September 2003 as a way for Valve to provide automatic updates for their games, and expanded to include games from third-party publishers. Steam has also expanded into an online web-based and mobile digital storefront. Steam offers digital rights management (DRM), server hosting, video streaming, and social networking services. It also provides the user with installation and automatic updating of games, and community features such as friends lists and groups, cloud storage, and in-game voice and chat functionality.

The software provides a freely available application programming interface (API) called Steamworks, which developers can use to integrate many of Steam's functions into their products, including in-game achievements, microtransactions, and support for user-created content through Steam Workshop. Though initially developed for use on Microsoft Windows operating systems, versions for macOS and Linux were later released. Mobile apps were also released for iOS, Android, and Windows Phone in the 2010s. The platform also offers a small selection of other content, including design software, hardware, game soundtracks, anime, and films.
